newsitem.title: GERMANY: Siemens buys AEG unit from Daimler.
newsitem.headline: Siemens buys AEG unit from Daimler.

text.p: German giant Siemens AG said on Monday it would buy AEG Electrocom GmbH, a postal sorting systems maker owned by Diamer Benz AG.
The price of the deal was not disclosed.

The sale includes AEG ElectroCom International Inc of the United States, where the company gets about 70 percent of its sales. AEG Electrocom's 1996 sales should reach about one billion marks, up from 650 million marks in 1995, Siemens said.
AEG Electrocom has installed about 10,000 letter sorting and recognition systems in more than 20 countries. Sixty percent of its 3,000 employees are located in Germany, 40 percent in the U.S.
Siemens and Daimler plan to complete the sale by April, although it is effective as of January 1, 1997, Siemens said.
